intro: Astroloma compactum, commonly known as the compact astroloma, is a small, evergreen shrub native to Western Australia. It features dense, rounded foliage with small, glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white, star-shaped flowers during the warmer months. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing drought tolerance. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
